comments:
When connecting to a repository using the :extssh: protocol, Eclipse CVS client 
assumes that there will always exist an implementation for the SHA1 pseudo-
number generation algorithm (it catches and ignores NoSuchAlgorithmException). 

When running on an environment where this algorithm is not available, an 
internal error is occurs (due to a NullPointerException in the first try of 
using the generator). The corresponding  stack trace appears in the end of this 
description.

I would suggest not to ignore that exception and to show a more explanative 
message such as "There is no support for secure CVS connections in the current 
Java runtime environment" or something like that.

I'm using:

Eclipse Platform

Version: 2.0
Build id: 200209181231

Stack trace:
java.lang.NullPointerException
